section.name: Contributing factors that make learning English difficult for ELLs
section.summary:
Now that we've talked about the prevalence of ELLs in the United States, let's consider:

What can make learning English difficult for ELLs?

There are many contributors that should be considered, including:

  • limited academic skills with the primary language;
  • external problems with work, health, or family;
  • stress or trauma that was experienced early in life;
  • social or cultural identity issues;
  • a mismatch between the instructor style and learner;
  • a lack of school attendance;
  • limited practice outside of the instructional setting; and
  • for some ELLs - undiagnosed learning disabilities that can impact learnersâ€™ ability to learn a new language.
